docs.snippet: Sterling was on track for its biggest daily losses in three months on Monday, sliding around 1 percent to a 10-week low to the dollar after Prime Minister Theresa May said she was not interested in Britain keeping "bits" of its EU membership....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sterling was on track for its biggest daily losses in three months on Monday, sliding around 1 percent to a 10-week low to the dollar after Prime Minister Theresa May said she was not interested in Britain keeping "bits" of its EU membership.

headline.main: Sterling Slides After PM May Reignites 'Hard Brexit' Fears
headline.print_headline: Sterling Slides After PM May Reignites 'Hard Brexit' Fears

docs.snippet: Turkish police used tear gas and water cannon to disperse hundreds of people outside parliament on Monday protesting against planned changes to the constitution that would expand the powers of President Tayyip Erdogan....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish police used tear gas and water cannon to disperse hundreds of people outside parliament on Monday protesting against planned changes to the constitution that would expand the powers of President Tayyip Erdogan.

headline.main: Turkish Police Fire Tear Gas at Protest Against Stronger Presidency
headline.print_headline: Turkish Police Fire Tear Gas at Protest Against Stronger Presidency

docs.snippet: Immigration has a generally positive economic impact on receiving countries but the benefits depend on how well the migrants are integrated, the International Monetary Fund's First Deputy Managing Director David Lipton said on Monday....

headline.main: Immigration Boosts Wealth, Does Not Increase Inequality: IMF
headline.print_headline: Immigration Boosts Wealth, Does Not Increase Inequality: IMF

docs.snippet: The British government said on Monday it is launching a national inquiry into cyber security to assess the extent to which the UK is protected from an ever-increasing tide of attacks worldwide....

headline.main: After U.S. Intel Report on Putin, British Government Launches Cyber Security Review
headline.print_headline: After U.S. Intel Report on Putin, British Government Launches Cyber Security Review

docs.snippet: The Vatican's doctrine chief says there is no need to correct Pope Francis over his outreach to divorced and civilly remarried Catholics because "there is no danger to the faith" in what he has said....

docs.snippet: Official figures show that unemployment across the 19-country eurozone held steady in November at 9.8 percent....

docs.snippet: Iranian lawmakers approved plans on Monday to expand military spending to five percent of the budget, including developing the country's long-range missile program which U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has pledged to halt....

headline.print_headline: Iran to Expand Military Spending, Develop Missiles

docs.snippet: German carmaker Volkswagen said on Monday it would strongly defend itself in a case launched by a British law firm seeking thousands of pounds of compensation for drivers affected by the diesel emissions scandal....

docs.snippet: Four Gulf states sent condolences on Monday for former Iranian president Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, signaling appreciation for a pragmatist who sought regional detente, but there was no immediate word from Riyadh, Tehran's main Gulf Arab advers...
docs.lead_paragraph: Four Gulf states sent condolences on Monday for former Iranian president Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, signaling appreciation for a pragmatist who sought regional detente, but there was no immediate word from Riyadh, Tehran's main Gulf Arab adversary.
